etymology.description: Pictogram – a hand grabbing from above (earlier forms from the side); compare 手, 寸, 九.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts an overhead view of fingers curved downward in a grasping motion, originally representing a human hand. The sense broadened to include animal claws, which is why it now names claws/talons and functions as the ‘claw’ radical in many compounds.

examples.chinese: 猫的爪子很锋利(貓的爪子很鋒利)。
examples.english: A cat’s claws are very sharp.

examples.chinese: 我买了一包鸡爪当小吃(我買了一包雞爪當小吃)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎile yī bāo jīzhuǎ dāng xiǎochī.
examples.english: I bought a bag of chicken feet as a snack.

examples.chinese: 地上有一串小狗的爪印(地上有一串小狗的爪印)。
examples.pinyin: Dì shàng yǒu yī chuàn xiǎogǒu de zhuǎyìn.
examples.english: There is a trail of puppy paw prints on the ground.
